downloadTitle: Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 Deployment Guide
downloadDescription: The Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 deployment guide is for IT managers, system administrators, or other people who are responsible for testing IRM implementation in Office for Mac.
detailsSection:
The Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 deployment guide is for IT managers, system administrators, or other people who are responsible for testing IRM implementation in Office for Mac. This guide describes the step-by-step process to set up Active Directory Rights Management Service (AD RMS) in a test environment, configure this server to work with the Mac clients, and use IRM with Office for Mac.

The Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 Deployment Guide covers the following:
  • Overview
     
  • About this document
     
  • Setting up IRM for Office for Mac
        Step 1: Prepare to install the AD RMS role on Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 RC or a later version
        Step 2: Install the AD RMS role on Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 RC or a later version
        Step 3: Configure AD RMS to connect to a Mac computer
        Step 4: Enable certification of server services
        Step 5: Verify the AD RMS setup
        Step 6: Verify the IRM functionality
        Troubleshooting the setup

  • Providing custom rights management policy templates in Office for Mac 2011
     
  • Using IRM in Office for Mac
    Predefined groups of permissions
systemRequirementsSection:
Note: To view the Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 Deployment Guide .pdf in Windows, you will need the free software program, Adobe Reader.

For information about the system requirements for Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011, see the "Setting up IRM for Office for Mac" section in the Information Rights Management in Office for Mac 2011 Deployment Guide.
installInstructionSection:
To install this download on Mac OS X:
  1. Print this page if you want to use it as a reference when you are offline.
  2. Click the download.
  3. Follow the instructions on the screen to save the file to your hard disk. If you are using Safari, the downloaded file is saved to the desktop unless you specified a different location in the Preferences dialog box of Safari. To check your preferences, on the Safari menu, click Preferences, and then click General).
  4. On your hard disk, double-click the file that you downloaded.

To install this download on Windows:
  1. Print this page if you want to use it as a reference when you are offline.
  2. Click the download.
  3. Do one of the following:
    • To start the installation immediately, click Open or Run.
    • To copy the download to your computer for installation at a later time, click Save or Save this program to disk.
  4. On your hard disk, double-click the file that you downloaded.
